activities: Proteus will receive information from or about individual consumers through the combined use of digital medicines that communicate when they have been taken, wearable sensors that capture physiologic data, and applications that support patient self-care and physician making and data analytic to serve the needs of doctors, health systems and governments.  The information provided to us is in accordance with the rules and regulations promulgated by the National Health System in the United Kingdom. We use the information collected through our Services in order to provide the Service, and conduct research as described in the Proteus Privacy Policy and in the Proteus Terms of Use. We may also collect personal information from individuals who visit our website for the purpose of engaging in certain activities or receiving requested materials. We may use this information for marketing purposes and to improve the Site, as described in the Privacy Policy. We also collect personal information from our employees and job applicants.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Data collected online and offline - Customer and Employee
